# Connecting with Opal data server
## Login to server and assign study data
```{r, echo=FALSE}
#Load Opal R library
library(opal)
library(data.table)
# Create an opal object with the login information
erasmus_opal <-opal.login('agurer','1234tamamw','https://obiba.erasmusmc.nl')
#Login to Opal server and assign the content of the LASA table(s) to your RStudio environment

# LASA2B
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'LASA2B', 'LASA.LASA2B_biodata',variables = list('bmalbumi','bmtsh','bmcrp','bmtrigly','bmfreet4','bmvitd25', "bmvitd25st"))
LASA2B <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'LASA2B')

# LASA2G
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'LASA2G', 'LASA.LASA2G_biodata',variables = list('gmalbumi',"gmvitd25", "gmvitd25st"))
LASA2G <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'LASA2G')

```
## Assign participant id as first column of your harmonized dataframes
```{r, echo=FALSE}
bio_LASA2_0 <- data.frame(id = LASA2B$id)
bio_LASA2_2 <- data.frame(id = LASA2G$id)


```
## When you are done with your work, logout of Opal server
```{r, echo=FALSE}
#opal.logout(erasmus_opal) 
```
###After the other steps of harmonization is done, replacing all -1's and -2's with NA's and checking the datasets

```{r, echo=FALSE}
bio_LASA2_0[bio_LASA2_0==-1|bio_LASA2_0==-2]<-NA
str(bio_LASA2_0)
View(bio_LASA2_0)

bio_LASA2_2[bio_LASA2_2==-1|bio_LASA2_2==-2]<-NA
str(bio_LASA2_2)

```

# Non-genetic Biomarkers subdomain

### **Variable label**: C-Reactive Protbein  
**Variable name**: BIO_CRP_0    
**Variable description**: C-Reactive Protein measured in serum (fresh and frozen).    
**Value type**: Decimal 
**Variable unit**: mg/L  
**Category coding**:     

**Harmonization status**:  complete
**Harmonization comment**: Available in 6 studies: CLSA, HUNT, LASA, MESA, RS, HAPIEE (baseline only)  
**Harmonization comment**:There are 2 variables for CRP in LASA1: bmcrp and bmhscrp. And possibly bmhscrp is preferred as the LASA documentation states: 
"Please note that CRP levels have also been determined directly after blood sampling (both in 1992/93 and in 1995/96), but this has been done for respondents in the Zwolle region only (N=384; see â€œDocu bloedbepaling B en C). However, for complete use of all available CRP data, it is strongly recommended to use data from file B+C861 (inflammatory markers), because this file includes the measurements of respondents in all regions. Also, the CRP determination in Zwolle was performed with a less sensitive assay than the CRP determination in the blood samples from all regions." C861 includes bmhscrp, not bmcrp. But for LASA2 we only have bmcrp measure. If we use this one it might not be comparable with LASA1 if we do not use the bmcrp for LASA1 as well. However, in that case the number of NAs will be very high and that might not be an equally reliable measure.  

**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
#Checking the varibale bmcrp (Blood: CRP mG/L)

table(LASA2B$bmcrp, useNA = "always")
sum(LASA2B$bmcrp!=-2)

bio_LASA2_0$bio_crp_0<-LASA2B$bmcrp
table(bio_LASA2_0$bio_crp_0, useNA = "always")
summary(bio_LASA2_0$bio_crp_0)
is.numeric(bio_LASA2_0$bio_crp_0)
```

### **Variable label**: Vitamin D 
**Variable name**: BIO_VitD_0    
**Variable description**: Vitamin D measured in serum (fresh and frozen).    
**Value type**: Decimal 
**Variable unit**: ng/ml  
**Category coding**: 
**Harmonization status**:  complete
**Harmonization comment**: Available in 5 studies: CLSA, HUNT, LASA, MESA, RS  
**Harmonization comment**:There are 2 variables: cmvitd25st (serum: 25-hydroxyvitamin D (25(OH)D), nmol/L, ODIN-standardized) and 
cmvitd25 (serum: 25-hydroxyvitamin D (25(OH)D), nmol/L). "In 2015, serum 25(OHD) values were standardized using the Vitamin D Standardization Program (VDSP) protocol as part of the European ODIN study" From NIH website (https://ods.od.nih.gov/Research/vdsp.aspx): "art of the ODS Vitamin D Initiative, VDSP is an international collaborative effort to standardize the laboratory measurement of vitamin D status." So should we use the standardized measure to make it more comparable across time and studies. However, if other cohorts didn't use this measure maybe there is not much point?

**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}

table(LASA2B$bmvitd25st, useNA = "always")
table(LASA2B$bmvitd25, useNA = "always")

summary(LASA2B$bmvitd25)
summary(LASA2B$bmvitd25st)

bio_LASA2_0$bio_vitd_0<-LASA2B$bmvitd25st
#1 ng/ml =0.400641 nmol/l
bio_LASA2_0$bio_vitd_0[bio_LASA2_0$bio_vitd_0==-1]<-NA
bio_LASA2_0$bio_vitd_0<-bio_LASA2_0$bio_vitd_0*0.400641
table(bio_LASA2_0$bio_vitd_0, useNA = "always")
summary(bio_LASA2_0$bio_vitd_0)

```
